instruction: How did the researchers evaluate the effectiveness of machine learning models in discriminating classes of region and variety in vineyards based on radiometric measurements of grape leaves?
Output: The researchers evaluated the effectiveness of machine learning models in discriminating classes of region and variety in vineyards based on radiometric measurements of grape leaves by applying techniques of dimensionality reduction to define the most relevant wavelengths. The researchers reported the accuracy of each model in spectral discrimination by region and variety. The LGBM model achieved the highest accuracy in discriminating classes of region, followed by the RF model. For discriminating grape varieties, both the LGBM and RF models achieved better results. The researchers also identified the wavelengths that were most relevant for discrimination, which were primarily in the ultraviolet, blue, and green spectral regions.
